result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin P. Boomsma was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Shall receive 63 days presentence credit should supervision be revoked

miscConds.notes: To victim to be paid through Clerk of Courts office; payment to be established
To be paid through the Clerk of Courts; shall establish payment plan
Shall apply to 10 places per week when unemployed
Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as directed by agent
Shall have no contact or communication with victims
Shall submit a DNA sample; shall write a letter of apology to the victims to be submitted through agent
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to: Sentence shall commence on or before Court ordered start date;  with work release and transfer privileges

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
